item.title: Fathers Day
item.description: As a warning, this post has content relating to death, depression, and alcohol abuse. I resented my father. Past tense. For a couple of reasons. The obvious one is that he passed shortly before I turned 18. The other reason is that I’ve come to terms with our differences. My father loved me. He adored me. And he wanted the best for me (even threatened to leave my mother and take me with him during a time when her drug use was at one of its peaks), and he did his damndest to provide for me and my mother.

item.title: Trusting Your Gut
item.description: I think we all have a specific moment in which we learn to trust that little voice in the back of our heads; the one that tells us, “You should run.” Sometimes it’s wrong, and you have to look at the situation to figure that out, but sometimes listening to it is the best choice you can make. To provide some background, both of my parents were recovering alcoholics and drug addicts, and both attended our local Alcoholics Anonymous club (henceforth referred to as “the Club”).

item.title: Importance of Taking Care of One's Health
item.description: Yay, first “Personal” category post! So, I’m definitely not “cool” enough to have people tracking my every move (except for my assigned FBI agent. Hi!), but if you look at my #100daysofcode tracker, you might notice only a single tally mark since the original publication, and a total of “1.5.” How could I have completed 1.5 days of code? Well, I got sick. It’s just a cold, but colds knock me out pretty bad, and they’re viruses, so not much can be done about them outside of fluids/rest (technically, I suppose antibiotics could treat them, but I’m not contributing to the overuse of antibiotics).
